parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From para and eisphero; to bear in alongside, i.e. Introduce simultaneously.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
(a) speed, haste, (b) diligence, earnestness, enthusiasm. From speudo; 'speed', i.e. despatch, eagerness, earnestness.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From epi and choregeo; to furnish besides, i.e. Fully supply, aid or contribute.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
Goodness, a gracious act, virtue, uprightness. From the same as arrhen; properly, manliness, i.e. Excellence.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Goodness, a gracious act, virtue, uprightness. From the same as arrhen; properly, manliness, i.e. Excellence.
Knowledge, doctrine, wisdom. From ginosko; knowing, i.e. knowledge.
